data.title: Dependable Italian
data.text: A couple of times a month we order delivery when we are feeling like Italian. Hard to beat this stuff. Haven't been disappointed except last week when they didn't have a driver to deliver. What?? I'll keep calling though. Good.

data.title: Very Good Standard Italian Cuisine, good service,
data.text: Had dinner there with a small group...ordered the cheese ravioli...it was fresh and tasty, altho the sauce was somewhat bland. The service was excellent, and the staf was friendly and attentive. We'll be back!

data.title: Delicious pizza
data.text: This is the closest thing I've had to New York/New Jersey pizza that I've found in Virginia. It's delicious. I recommend the margherita pizza, but I tasted buffalo and some kind of supreme Stromboli and they were really good. My husband from New Jersey concurred! We will definitely be back.

data.title: Surprised by very good entrees!
data.text:
We are loyal Mama Rosa's diners but we were on the other side of town and decided to try Papa C's.  It was just as good as Mama Rosas and the Shrimp Fra Diavolo was even better then Mama Rosas.  
We decided to skip pizza and try 3 different entress.  All were very good and the portions were HUGE!  Consider sharing if you like your dining partners.  The service was casual and friendly.  
The only thing I didn't really like was the ambience/ environment.  It was much more "Pizza Place" then restaurant.  I wish they would "warm" it up a bit like they have done at Mama Rosas. Unfortunately the  temperature was a bit wacky and WARM.  It seemed like the AC wasn't keeping up and it needed to be much cooler inside.  

I would certainly go back and suggest this place to everyone.

data.title: Screwed us twice!
data.text: Not once but twice did we call in an order to pick up at this place.  We show up to pick up our order and they hadn't even put it in! This place is an embarrassment to the restaurant industry.

data.title: Great quick pizza and service!
data.text: Top notch customer service when we were looking for carry out pizza for a large group of volunteers. The toppings were fresh and the pizza was flavorful. They even helped with ice during the crazy heat... By far some knock out pizza and service, thank you!!!

data.title: Great Italian dinners
data.text: We have had three dinners that were all excellent with the pastas homemade and very good and cheerful service. We plan more visits for dinner there.

data.title: Pizzza
data.text: This place delivered a very tasty and meaty pizza to me.  Jalapeno poppers and cheese sticks were average.  Chef salad was average as well.  Many other things on the menu.  Pizza is worth trying.

data.title: Pizza is fair
data.text: The pizza is okay but not great.  I certainly would not  go out of my way to go there again.  In addition to that, it's a bit pricey.

data.title: Checking this out on advice.
data.text: I came to Papa Ciccio's on the suggestion of a church member friend for a church fellowship and the agreement of my daughter who lives close by and is a patron.  For a Friday night, the place was not well attended, but the service was a bit slow from start to finish.  After a bit of a wait I ordered the spaghetti with sausage and peppers and was asked which pasta did I want?  I went with angel hair, but which was probably thin spaghetti instead.  The meal came with salad and bread, but the bread did not arrive with the salad.  The vinaigrette was quite nice - the salad plain - lettuce - not all iceberg - a bit of tomato, onion, and cucumber, okay, but it would have been nice to have had the not bread stick and butter with the salad.  The pasta was quite large, quite tasty, and with a bit of southern Italian kick to it.  I will talk to the restaurant about bringing my church here, but I do hope the service is up to it.

data.title: nothing more to say but "Excellent"
data.text: If you like Mama Rosa's then your going to love Papa's, just a little friendly family competition between father and son.

data.title: Now this is good food!
data.text: Papa Cicci's is a little gem of a restaurant tucked in a strip mall near the Hampton, VA Post Office. Very reasonable prices with stellar fare, and this is within walking distance of the Hampton Public Pier. Staff is attentive and friendly. Joy was a our server and she lives up to her name!
